questions_and_answers.question: If 10 men take 6 days to complete a task, how many man-days does the task require?
questions_and_answers.answer: The task requires 10 men * 6 days = 60 man-days.

questions_and_answers.question: The new job is double the original task. How many man-days does the new job require?
questions_and_answers.answer: The new job requires 60 man-days * 2 = 120 man-days.

questions_and_answers.question: If 8 men are working on the new job, and it requires 120 man-days, how many days will it take to complete?
questions_and_answers.answer: It will take 120 man-days / 8 men = 15 days.

questions_and_answers.question: If 10 men take 6 days to complete a task, how much work does 1 man do in 1 day (expressed as a fraction of the whole task)?
If one man does 1/60 of the task in one day, how much of the task will 8 men do in one day?
questions_and_answers.answer: 8/60 of the task, or 2/15 of the task
